dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tentatively, she takes his hand and holds it. From behind them, we HEAR A SHUFFLING SOUND. Adele turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping a discreet distance, EVERYONE from the diner is  following them. Adele turns and addresses the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group) You can all go home, now. He's not  going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on home, folks. And thanks for  the welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be home in a little while, Harry.  Don't wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two have a lot of catching up to  do, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, son. (tips his hat) 'Night, Delly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the rest of the crowd disperses, variously wishing th pair goodnight. Luke and Adele watch them disperse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. We're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and start walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do I feel like we're still  being shadowed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... where can we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a place. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand and they run toward the town square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele and Luke stand by the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not remember anything. Come  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand and they run to the side of the buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele and Luke stand by a basement window, inches off the ground. She looks around. Certain the coast is clear, she pounds on the window in three "special" places, and it po up and open. She looks at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a gentleman. You have to help me  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Luke climbs in, we

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE, MUSLIN-COVERED OBJECT.
dialogues.text: Slowly, the muslin is drawn off, revealing A STATUE OF A  KNEELING SOLIDER, praying before a soldier's grave. We sl PAN DOWN from the top of the statue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we were kids, my Dad was mayor,  and you and me and a bunch of others  used to come down here all the time.

dialogues.speaker: ON ADELE AND LUKE
dialogues.text: looking up at the statue in this city hall basement stora room, lit only by a single shaft of moonlight from the wi The muslin covering lay bunched at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, there was a lot more room  before they stuck the memorial down  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the door) How'd they get it inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the door. It comes apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to the memorial. Squinting, she examines its ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name's on here. See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. "Albert Lucas Trumbo."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the others. I knew them all. So did you. We went school with most of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't seem right, this being  down here. It ought to be where people  can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they commissioned it, no one  could ever agree on where to put it.  The Methodists wanted it in front of  the Methodist Church, the  Presbyterians wanted it in front of  the Presbyterian Church, the city  council wanted it in the lobby of  City Hall. Everyone finally got tired  of the fighting. So they stuck it  down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her for a long moment. There's an electricity between them, and they both feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're really gonna be a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive) And why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sorry. You don't know how many times  I've heard that. "A lady lawyer? Are  you crazy?" Like a woman couldn't be  as good a lawyer as a man. Or better,  in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you always wanted to be a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... don't remember, but yes, ever  since I was a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did... what did I want to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Oh, well... I guess you... in high  school, you were a pretty good first  baseman. And we were on the debate  team together. But... I think you  were gonna run the Bijou. You were  brought up there, and you loved it  so much. And I think you knew how  much the town needed a place like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away, rubs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish I could remember some of  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a boyfriend or  anyone... you know... like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was married. For four  years. But... well, we didn't fit  together. I'm divorced now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. See, when two people  belong together, the other person  should be the... the key that unlocks  the rest of you... I'm not making  sense, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward her) No, you are. I know exactly what you  mean. It's not that you're missing  something. It's that the other person  gives something to you... that you  had all the time. You just didn't  see it until they came along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in love... weren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes. (then:) Hic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She instantly covers her mouth, but it's no good. She has the hiccups again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (hic!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm (hic!) fine. Really. (hic!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke smiles and watches Adele as she makes the decision t not struggle against the hiccups. She has them, and that' just the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were we going to get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually. We were going to be (hic!) engaged... when you came back from (hic!) overseas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her. She's strikingly beautiful at this parti moment and in this particular light -- hiccups and all. H moves closer to her. She moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) ...but you had to go... serve (hic!) your country...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss passionately. She reaches up and puts her arms  around him. He starts kissing her neck, and she suddenly  realizes -- she's stopped hiccuping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she smiles and kisses him again we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke comes down the street and heads for the front door. has a definite spring in his step as he pulls out his key and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very dark. Luke is about to swing shut the heavy doo when he looks down and sees

dialogues.speaker: THE ORANGE TABBY CAT
dialogues.text: shoot into the lobby, stopping in the middle of the floor It looks at Luke, and PURRS. Luke closes the door and moves to the cat. He crouches do and pets it, and its back rises to meet his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fella. So you live here, too,  huh? How come Harry didn't mention  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat moves to the auditorium door, pausing to look bac at Luke. Curiosity piqued, Luke follows the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dim light, we SEE an old mop and pail, some dirty  film cans, and a large beat-up cardboard standee of "The  Tramp" with the legend, "Chaplin Short To-Day." The cat comes around a corner and disappears through a do at the end of a hallway. Luke, following the cat, comes a the same corner and looks at THE DOOR. Slightly ajar, there's a light coming from within, as wel as the sound of Old Tim softly humming "It's a Long Way t Tipperary." Luke moves to the door and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Old Tim? Sorry, it's late. It's  Luke. Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humming stops, and after a moment, the door swings op revealing Old Tim, a pipe in his mouth, holding the cat,  stroking its fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I hope you don't mind. I didn't  know anyone lived here... well,  besides Harry. And me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim moves into the room and gestures for Luke to foll him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is lit by a small table lamp next to the neat co which is perfectly made, military-style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not used to visitors. (gesturing) Sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim points to a ragged, overstuffed easy chair next t the "kitchen" area -- a sink, dishes and utensils, a tiny icebox. Luke sits in the chair, and Old Tim sits on the cot, faci him. Silence. Luke glances up at a photo atop the bureau.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: It's a much younger Old Tim, looking quite serious and  handsome in his Great War doughboy's uniform. The cat jumps down from Old Tim's arms and moves to Luke. rubs against his legs, purring. Luke leans down to pet hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess this fellow belongs to  you. What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat. That's simple. I like it. (pets Cat) Hi, Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden change-of- subject) We thought you was dead, you know. (another new thought) It's okay that I live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause, then suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'll get me a new u-u  uniform?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks up at the old man, who stammers when he speaks more than a couple of words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do everything I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim puffs on his pipe, strangely detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-t-thank you. Thank you. I... I  always... I always wanted to wear my  uniform from the Great War, but your  daddy, he always said no, that's not  an usher's u-u-uniform, that's an  army uniform and the Bijou, she's  not the army. They give me a medal,  but I lost it in the h-h-hospital.   I forget things sometimes. Since the  w-w-war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty typical bachelor's apartment. The "SAND PIR poster leans up against a chair. Pete's two boxes of  belongings from the studio are on the coffee table, the e bottle of Jack Daniels on top. There's an insistent KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Appleton? Mr. Appleton? You in  there? This is the Super, I have the  master key and I'm coming in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the key in the lock and the door swings open,  revealing the building SUPER, 50s. Behind him is Leo Kube They enter the room, and the Super sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't smell nothin'. He must not be  dead in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's the best way to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo moves to the boxes and rummages through them. He pick up the empty bottle, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's drunk somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Wouldn't blame him if he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, his rent's past due and he  said to call you in case of an  emergency. He lose his job or  somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out his  folding money) What's his rent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo peels off a hundred-dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's three months rent, and a ten  spot for no more questions and to  keep an eye on his place. Now, I  need a moment alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining the bill) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a hike. Am-scray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, sure. Just pull the door  shut when you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Super exits and Leo crosses to the phone and dials "O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Police department. I want to report  a missing person.

dialogues.speaker: ON A DOOR
dialogues.text: It reads: "OFFICE OF THE MAJORITY COUNSEL - MR. ELVIN CLY AGENT WALTER SAUNDERS and AGENT STEVEN BRETT, both 30s an men to the core, hustle into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELVIN CLYDE is 35, a small, thin-lipped, reptilian man in the Roy Cohn mold. He's on the phone at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You say you know nothing about it.  You say this, yet you offer no proof.  How am I supposed to believe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde's SECRETARY knocks on the door, sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Clyde? Agents Saunders and Brett  need to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the phone) You do see that I'm busy, do you  not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Appleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde's eyes brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to come in. (into phone) I'll have to call you back. I love  you too, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saunders and Brett stride into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a situation developing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Will you take those goddamn hats  off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop, shuck off their hats. Saunders starts over aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a situation developing out  on the coast. Appleton's just been  reported missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde grins darkly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good. This is very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Angeles Police Department  investigated. His car's missing. No  signs of forced entry or struggle at  his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde considers this for a beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are on this as of now. Tell  the LAPD their investigation has  been federalized on my order. You  find me this Appleton. (leans back, smiling) I want to see what this one has to  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is sitting at the desk, making notes and adding up s figures. He puts his pencil down and rubs his eyes, then  looks up at

dialogues.speaker: HARRY AND OLD TIM
dialogues.text: who are sitting on the floor, going through piles of lobb cards and folded one-sheets like little boys fascinated w their baseball cards.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TERWILLIGER
dialogues.text: who is straightening out and dusting the tops of the two three file cabinets in the corner of the office. As she w she hums an old song, occasionally breaking into the lyri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings) "The object of my affection, Can  change my complexion, From white to  rosy red..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke takes a breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between a new screen, paint, plumbing  for the concession stand, and about  a hundred other repairs around the  theater... it's going to cost at  least nine hundred dollars to get  the Bijou into shape to open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Nine hundred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have sixty-eight dollars and  thirty-seven cents in the bank. Your  only source of income are my veteran's  death benefit of forty dollars a  month, to which you're no longer  entitled since I'm alive, and these  ten dollar a month cash deposits you  make. What are those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at Old Tim) They're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my r-r-rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all my fault. I was neglectful  and this is the price of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's true. Wanting to open  this place back up. It's folly, Irene,  pure and simple. Might as well just  call it what it is.

dialogues.text: Off everyone's worried looks, we

dialogues.text: It's tiny, with rounded corners, black-and-white, and a  hopeless chaos of horizontal bars and snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc Lardner is fiddling with a brand-new console televisi set, trying vainly to tune in a clear picture of "Your Sh of Shows." He adjusts the dials, fiddles with the rabbit  ears, steps back -- and is successful. SID CAESAR And IMO COCA are involved in an elaborate pantomime sketch, and  Lardner fairly roars with laughter. He turns to go back to his chair, but the second he does the reception goes haywire. He returns to the spot in fro of the TV, and the picture is perfect again. The DOORBELL RINGS. He's torn -- if he moves, the picture will break up. The doorbell RINGS again, and we HEAR Adel voice from upstairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, that's Luke, can you let him  in? I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I... I can't... it's the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in) Oh, hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves from his spot. The reception goes bad, and he ma to the door. He opens it, and Luke is standing there, wearing a slight out-of-date coat and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Doctor Lardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lardner freezes, staring at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken from his  reverie) Uh, no... just seeing you standing  there, it reminded me... there's a  word for it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean the suit. Harry kept  all my old clothes. Fits okay, but  it's a little big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele comes down the stairs. Halfway down, she stops sudd and stares at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward pause. Adele's staring at Luke, Lardner's staring Luke, and Luke's getting nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have worn the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele comes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... you were wearing that suit the  last time we went out before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it's just... well, deja vu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Deja vu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another awkward pause as Adele and Luke stare at each oth Lardner breaks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kids off to the dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not much of a dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chidingly) Besides, Daddy's still trying to  figure out how to get his new  television set working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it, a minute ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at the TV set. The picture is suddenly crystal clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ooooh, It's back. (encouraging them  toward the door) Well, you kids have fun now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele takes Luke's arm and they exit, exchanging goodnigh with Lardner, who closes the door and turns toward the li room. S-l-o-w-l-y, he sneaks into the room, watching the TV  carefully all the while. The reception is staying perfect Caesar and Coca are involved in an intricate bit of busin and Lardner wants to laugh, but he's afraid to. He stifle his urge, and heads for his chair. Gingerly, he sits. Sti perfect. Satisfied, he finally LAUGHS out loud and puts his feet u The picture goes completely haywire again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele and Luke walk along, arm-in-arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is strange. Do you feel it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done this before, so many times.   The last time was so long ago, but  it feels like yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, everyone's so excited about  the Bijou re-opening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) It's gonna cost over nine hundred  dollars to open the place, Delly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Nine hundred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and needless to say, none of  us has that kind of money lying  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a loan? You could go to  the bank...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loan to a man who ran his business  into the ground and his son who can't  account for the last nine-and-a-half  years of his life? Not likely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's got to be a way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Have you got a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tried to once. It was pretty  pitiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.text: Adele glances curiously at Luke as we

dialogues.text: Spencer Wyatt's big ban is comprised of a dozen or so  MUSICIANS about Spencer's age -- except for the drummer,  AVERY WYATT, 40s, Spencer's dad. dialogues.text: (nodding toward the  band) They're not bad.

dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.text: Back in '37, you heard Benny Goodman  play for the first time, so you went  out and got a used clarinet. You  wanted nothing more than to be able  to play like him. dialogues.text: Huh. That was nice of me.

dialogues.text: You had a hidden agenda, though.  See, when he was five or six, little  Spence used to follow you around  like a puppy. Bothered the hell out  of you. But as soon as you gave him  the clarinet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he started practicing, and he  left me alone from then on.

dialogues.text: Exactly. And he got good.

dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dance a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, did you remember that, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Just filling in the blanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay.

dialogues.text: And as they dance away, we

dialogues.speaker: ON THE REFRESHMENTS TABLE
dialogues.text: Luke is pouring two glasses of punch, while Adele is bein shyly admired (and having her ear bent) by two twin broth ALEX and CHARLIE MCKENNA, mid-20s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the luckiest guy in town,  Luke. Delly's 'bout the prettiest  thing ever come outta Lawson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Thanks, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Alex. He's Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir, 'bout the prettiest thing we  ever seen, ain't that right, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ala Mae West) Thanks boys, ya flatter me no end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brothers laugh goofily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's doin' that movie star,  what's her name...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring his brother) Hey, Delly, what was that test you  was outta town takin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called the State Bar Exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine that, Charlie! A lady  bartender!

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: Adele and Luke are slow dancing to "Thanks for the Memory

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you tell those two apart,  anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Charlie? Simple. Alex is  the smarter one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... pretty frightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh and dance a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dancing's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never used to be. You were two  left feet on the dance floor. Like  pulling teeth to get you to do a  little box step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I must've learned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke dances Adele away, a slightly nonplussed expression her face. The band finishes the song, and everyone  enthusiastically APPLAUDS. Spencer bows shyly, blushing  slightly. He nods to the band, and they bow before he mot for the crowd's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Thanks, folks. Gee, can you tell we  never played in front of people  before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd yells "No!," "You guys sound great!," etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is our first time, and  it's really all because of Luke. I  mean, it's because of Luke coming  back that we're here tonight -- but  I'm talking about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the clarinet and scans the crowd until he see Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Luke) When you didn't come back, I learned  how to play this so I could remember  you. And now that you're back, well,  I'll never forget you. (to the crowd) Luke gave me this clarinet, but he  gave this night to all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd APPLAUDS warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay folks, here's Mayor Cole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd APPLAUDS as Ernie Cole mounts the band riser. H turns and addresses Avery Wyatt, on drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty proud of your boy, Avery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery smiles broadly and beats the KICK DRUM five or six  times to register his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you might have to find  someone else to mix paint at the  store, 'cause I think Spencer's got  a big career ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE again, and Ernie waits for it to settle. As soon he starts speaking, the crowd becomes totally silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know folks, here in Lawson, we  gave a lot for our country. A lot.  And we never complained and we never  faltered. And we never forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie's voice cracks slightly with emotion. He clears his throat and continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never forgot. And so when one of  our own came back to us, I gotta  tell you folks, it was like a miracle.   Luke, seein' you walking down the  street, it was... well, it was kinda  like seein' one of my boys alive  again. I think I speak for everyone  here when I say that not a day goes  by when we don't keep our boys'  memories alive. But Luke, having you  back among us... well, it helps us  keep their spirits alive, too. God  bless you, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd APPLAUDS. Adele takes Luke's hand and smiles. Ernie wipes his eyes and changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, enough a'that. This is a  celebration, so let's have us a good  time -- but not too good a time,  'cause I see just about every member  of the city council here tonight,  and we have an eight a.m. council  meeting tomorrow morning, and I expect  y'all to be there! All right, take  it away, Spencer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spencer kicks the band into the next tune as we

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: Luke and Adele come over to Harry and Mrs. Terwilliger,  standing at the periphery. Old Tim stands a few feet back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you two get out there and  dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Terwilliger blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't danced with another man  since Mr. Terwilliger passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen-oh-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry touches Luke's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, we're gonna go. You two kids  have a lovely time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnights are exchanged, and the trio leaves. Alex McKen comes up to Adele and taps her on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly, can I have a dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex leads her to the dance floor as Adele shoots Luke a  little "help me!" look. Luke smiles back and watches the  dancing crowd. After a moment, a man in a white suit and tie, ROSCOE FITTS, 40s, comes over to Luke and extends hi hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, you probably don't remember  me, Roscoe Fitts, I'm the grocer  here in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his hand) Good to meet you. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Ernie said, we're all glad to  have you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I hear you and Harry are planning  on re-opening the Bijou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna try. Place needs a lot  of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only imagine. You know, I spoke  with your Dad last year about maybe  taking the Bijou off his hands. I  don't think he gave it very much  thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he loves the place. It's his  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, I'm hopping you can help him  see the reality of the situation.  I'll come to the point. I want to  buy the property, and I'm prepared  to offer six-thousand dollars for  it. And that's just for the property,  mind you. If you want, I'll leave it  to you and your father to dismantle  and liquidate the building for  whatever salvage value it has, and  you keep those proceeds. I just want  the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) That's... well, that's very generous,  but if you've already got a store...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The days of the storefront grocery  are numbered. I plan on putting up a  free-standing supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's an alien word) A super market. Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it over. No reason to risk  financial ruin for the sake of a  crumbling old building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitts takes Luke's hand and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to have you back, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Luke watches Fitts walk off, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last dance, folks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd MOANS slightly, and Spencer kicks the band into "Moonlight Serenade," slow and easy.

dialogues.speaker: ON ADELE AND LUKE
dialogues.text: As they hold each other close and dance. Adele rests her  head on Luke's shoulder, her eyes closed. Luke strokes he hair and sways her gently to the music. Luke looks toward the edge of the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Leffert is standing there, staring at the band. Mabel comes up behind him and taps him on the shoulder. She's a him if he would like to dance. Bob looks down at the grou self-consciously shoves his hook-hand in his pocket and m away, leaving Mabel standing there. As Luke watches and the MUSIC CONTINUES OVER, WE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Adele dancing... ...walking slowly arm-in-arm down Adele's street, up her  walk to her door... ...kissing passionately on her doorstep... ...Adele going inside and Luke walking away, each unable take their eyes off the other... ...Luke walking the quiet streets of Lawson, smiling  beatifically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke turns the corner and heads for the theater door. He  pulls out his keys and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's about to close the door, when he looks down and se

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: MEOWING at him from the sidewalk. He holds the door open, and Cat shoots into the lobby, disappearing into the  auditorium. Luke closes the door... and stops. He HEARS  something, and so do we. Soft and faraway, it's a PIANO. The melody is soft, lilting -- almost a lullaby. Luke turns toward the music, which is coming from the  auditorium. The piano continues, building slightly in vol He moves to the auditorium doors and tentatively pushes o open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke enters, his face bathed in the soft, flickering,  reflected light of THE SCREEN. The movie is "The Big Parade." The old, decomposing nitra print is badly scratched and stained. A young, beautiful  Renee Adoree is bidding a tearful farewell to her lover,  John Gilbert, as he marches off to fight the Great War. Luke stares at the screen. The look on his face is one of bewilderment -- and awe.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIANO
dialogues.text: The rickety old upright is tinny-sounding and slightly ou of-tune. But it really doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Terwilliger is playing passionately. She never takes her eyes -- which are full of tears -- off the tattered  screen, except to close them when she is overcome with  emotion. Even so, she never misses a beat.

dialogues.speaker: HER HANDS
dialogues.text: fairly dance upon the keys. Stiff and wrinkled as they ar they manage to elicit every possible fragment of sensitiv that the old piano can muster. Luke is moved by what he's witnessing. This is the magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the right of Luke, sitting in the center of a row, is Tim. Stroking Cat, Old Tim stares at the poignant scene  unfolding on the screen, pausing only to wipe his eyes an nose with a handkerchief. He doesn't notice

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: who looks up towards the projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: A BRIGHT, WHITE, FLICKERING LIGHT,
dialogues.text: filling the frame. We're looking directly into the beam o light radiating from the projector. PUSHING INTO THE LIGHT, we get closer to the windows of t booth. We come out of the beam and can just barely make o the figure of Harry, framed in a small window next to the projector. WE CONTINUE PUSHING IN -- closer and closer -- until Harr face fills the screen. He is watching the film; his eyes wide and moist, as though he's experiencing the magic tha unfolding on the screen for the very first time. The warning bell on the projector CHIMES THREE TIMES,  signaling the end of the reel. Harry moves away from the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never taking his eyes off the screen, Harry watches as th film comes to an end and flap! Falp! Falps! Out of the  projector. He kills the motor and cranks the carbon arcs  apart, and the bright beam dies. It's not the end of the  movie, but it is the end of the only fragment they have. Harry moves to the house lights rheostat, and slowly fade them up. This done, he pulls a handkerchief from his back pocket and blows his nose loudly. He crosses back to the projector, unlatches the full take reel and takes it down. He's about to move away, when he  senses that he's not alone. He looks over the projector t see

dialogues.speaker: LUKE,
dialogues.text: standing there. Their eyes meet. Someone should say somet both men search for words. Suddenly, Luke feels very out- place, almost embarrassed -- as though he's interrupted a very private ritual. Harry senses this. Clutching the precious reel of film ti to his chest, he searches Luke's face and smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, son, I wish I could've shown  you more, but this is all that's  left. Just this one reel that never  got sent back from a picture we showed  here a long time ago. Nineteen twenty- five, to be exact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tiny laugh) Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, since you've been back,  that's the first time you've called  me "Dad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father and son look at each other for a long moment --  searching each other's eyes. Harry smiles a sort-of half- smile at Luke, and, still clutching the reel, crosses to rewind bench. Methodically, he mounts it and threads the of the film onto an empty reel. Slowly, he begins to turn the crank, rewinding the film. He stops and looks to where Luke was standing... but he's not there.

dialogues.speaker: PROJECTION BOOTH DOOR
dialogues.text: Luke is leaning up against the wall just outside of the  projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: As he closes his eyes... FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY
dialogues.text: In bed, sound asleep, snoring. A HAND reaches into frame shakes him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry. Dad, wake up. Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry opens his eyes and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bleary) Luke... what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-thirty. (smiles) I thought we'd get an early start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meeting of the Lawson City Council is in session, Mayor Cole presiding. Of the dozen council MEMBERS, we also  recognize Avery Wyatt and Roscoe Fitts. VERA DWIGHT, the  council secretary, a cherubic woman in her 40s, is readin the minutes of the last meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Roscoe Fitts moved, and Red  Curtis seconded, that the council  form a committee to investigate the  adoption of a new property taxation  structure. Motion carried, nine to  two, one abstention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vera speaks, the meeting room door opens and Luke, Har Old Time and Mrs. Terwilliger slip inside and take seats the unoccupied benches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Vera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie notices Luke and the trio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the chair notes the presence  this morning of Luke and Harry Trumbo  and the rest of the Bijou staff.  Frankly, the chair notes the presence  of just about anyone who ever finds  their way into one of these meetings.   G'moring, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just guessing, but I bet it's  not a sudden interest in Lawson  politics that brings you all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no... (clears his throat) I wanted to thank you all for giving  me such a nice welcome, and making  me feel at home. But I... we're...  actually here on business of a sort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALEY THORNHILL, 30s, the council parliamentarian, pipes He's waving a copy of "Roberts Rules of Order."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point of order, Mr. Mayor, this comes  under the heading "New Business,"  and this is not the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can make an exception  here, Daley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll need to be moved and seconded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie rolls his eyes, then quickly and mechanically, with inflection:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, motion to hear the speaker  out of order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion on the floor, discussion open,  discussion closed, all those in favor  signify by saying "aye."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opposed? Hearing no opposition, the  motion is carried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Ernie turns to Luke and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Well, I'll make this short  and sweet. The Bijou needs a lot of  repairs, and the truth of the matter  is, Harry, um, that is, Dad and me,  Mrs. Terwilliger and Old Tim, we  can't possible afford them all. So,  I'd like to ask your help to... well,  to scrounge around a bit, and see if  you have anything that might help us  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinds of things are you talking  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, paint, brushes, plaster, light  bulbs, yardage, and if you can't  come up with any of that, we can use  some old-fashioned elbow grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitts leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you do intend to fix the place  up after all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fitts, with all due respect, I  think Lawson needs the Bijou a bit  more than it needs a super market.  And I think Lawson deserves the Bijou.  There's not a lot that can be done  to help us get past the pain we've  all felt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Harry and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I think a good dose of magic  is as good a place as any to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The council members MURMUR amongst themselves, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Motion to encourage the citizenry of  Lawson to help out the Bijou in any  way they can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a subtle reminder) ...short of the allocation of city  funds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) ...short of allocation of city funds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Seconded!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) Motion on the floor, discussion open,  discussion closed, all those in favor  signify by saying "aye."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AYE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing no opposition, the motion is  carried! Congratulations, Luke, you  got yourself a town to help you out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the entire city council and the Bijou trio looks on, L moves to the memorial and pulls down the huge piece of mu covering it. Harry steps forward and gathers some of it i his arms. Ernie and Daley step forward and look up at the monument. Ernie touches the names of his two sons inscribed on the  base of the monument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) You know, this really ought to be  out where people can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke overhears this last, and as he smiles, he turns to H who brightens as he pulls a large section of the muslin t between his outstretched arms...

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Harry's on a ladder, snipping the cords holding up the ol screen, which is dropping, bit-by-bit, into the arms of L and Adele, who are surrounded by a group of LITTLE KIDS,  watching the goings-on in wide-eyed awe. Harry snips the last line, and the rest of the old screen drops down on Luke's head. Suddenly... LUKE'S A GHOST!! H raises his arms and plays the bogeyman for the kids, who  scream in mock terror and scatter, as Harry and Adele lau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim and Harry carry a dilapidated row of seats up the aisle, as Adele and Mabel move in, tearing up the rotten  carpeting and sweeping up the dust and debris. The men are having a tough time carrying the seats, and j as they're about to drop the row, someone rushes in next Harry and grabs his end. It's Carl Leffert. A second late someone else grabs Old Tim's end.

dialogues.speaker: BOB LEFFERT
dialogues.text: has a good purchase on the seats with his good hand and h hook. He nods to Old Tim, who steps away, mopping his bro Luke smiles as he sees this from the front of the auditor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Stanton and Mrs. Terwilliger, with the help of Ave Wyatt and his son Spencer, tear down the rotting draperie and scrape off the wallpaper covering the lobby walls. Th as Harry, Spencer and Stanton sand down the walls, Avery Mrs. Terwilliger hand them freshly-mixed cans of red wall paint and brushes. Immediately, they all set to work pain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is on the roof of the theater, pliers in hand and to box nearby. He's just straightened out the "J" and he ste back... carefully... to admire his handiwork. For the fir time in a long time, the sign actually reads, "THE BIJOU. But not for long. Luke tenses... the building starts  shaking... and the train passes by behind the theater. Lu lunges out of the way as three letters shake lose and fal Once again, the sign reads, " HE B J U."  Luke winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie Cole and Avery Wyatt stand solemnly at the front of small group gazing at the base of the war memorial, as it takes shape in a prominent place in the square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is on a ladder, attaching the final spring stretche to a corner of the muslin. It snaps into place, and voila new screen! Luke, Adele, Doc Lardner, and Sheriff Eldridg standing below, applaud enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As work progresses all around her, Mrs. Terwilliger has j finished dusting off the piano. She opens the keyboard co and trails her hand delicately over the keys. She sits, c her eyes, and begins to play -- Chopin's Op. 10 Etude No. delicate, flowing music. Even though the piano is a bit o of tune, it's still beautiful. As she plays, all the work slowly comes to a halt. Before long, all eyes are on her. Everyone's listening. Transported. After a moment, she stops. Overcome. Everyone applauds. Surprised, Mrs. Terwilliger stands, and, blushing, bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taught you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can play the piano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all fluttery) Oh dear, yes. You were an excellent  student, before all that clarinet  nonsense. You loved Chopin. You used  to call it "heaven music." "Teach me  some heaven music," you used to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits at the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. Play with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of it might come back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, Luke sits down to her left. As she begins to play a Chopin waltz, she encourages him to keep the 3/4 t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good... that's good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's clear Luke has no idea what he's doing. He's jus plunking bass notes. But after a moment, the bass figures he's improvising start to change -- and before long, it's transformed into the eight-to-the-bar figure of a boogie  woogie beat. Mrs. Terwilliger stops playing, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Luke! That's no way to treat  Mr. Chopin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and moves away. Luke keeps playing, grinning m he's loving it! After a moment, Spencer Wyatt runs over a takes Mrs. Terwilliger's place, improvising the top half Luke's bass line.

dialogues.speaker: OLD TIM
dialogues.text: is tapping his foot to the beat. He turns to Adele and sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taught him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Adele cracking up. THE MONTAGE CONTINUES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and all the letters up again. He steps back, checks watch, and like clockwork, the rumbling begins and a trai goes by. This time, however, only the "J" tips over at a  jaunty angle. Luke smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, Adele and Harry, wearing coveralls, sit at the coun devouring hefty plates of turkey with dressing and mashed potatoes and gravy. Luke's and Adele's hair is practicall white from plaster dust and Harry's face and hands are st with paint specks. At the other side of the counter, Mabel is chatting amiab with Bob Leffert. She smiles at him warmly, then turns to refill Harry's coffee cup. Harry thanks her, then turns b to the newspaper he's reading.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT PAGE OF THE LAWSON JOURNAL-AMERICAN
dialogues.text: Prominent is the black-and-white photo of a little boy an policeman holding up Pete's jacket, with the accompanying headline:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood Writer Feared Dead Were Red Agents Involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's standing near the sign. He yells to Adele, down be on the ground. She, in turn, yells to Harry, standing nea switch panel behind the candy counter. He throws the swit ...and the sign lights up beautifully! Then, they all fee the rumble -- the train rolls past, and, although they ra and shake, no letters fall. A CHEER goes up from Adele, H and the small crowd of ONLOOKERS below. Delighted, Luke t a formal bow. The boogie-woogie ends as we

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MEMORIAL
dialogues.text: Complete and polished, standing proudly in the center of square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a clear, balmy day, and the whole town is turned out Mayor Ernie Cole is at the podium. He finishes his remark then picks up the two faded gold stars representing the l lives of his sons. He holds them up, high above his head.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CROWD
dialogues.text: One-by-one, the gold stars of the town's boys are solemnl held aloft by their loved ones. Luke and Harry stand at the side of the square, looking o at the sea of four or five dozen gold stars being held al Luke catches a glimpse of a man in an army uniform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bob Leffert, standing with Mabel, looking very sharp his dress greens. He brings his hook-hand up and salutes  smartly. Mabel takes his good hand, squeezes it as she bl back tears. Luke smiles at this scene as Harry wipes his eyes and put his arm around Luke's shoulder, pulls him close and kisse him on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: The Lawson High School Marching Band is set up on the ste of City Hall, playing the "Star Spangled Banner." They ar being conducted by their director, MR. PHILLIPS. Luke and Harry, hands over their hearts, watch and sing along. The Luke takes a closer look at the DRUM MAJOR...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DRUM MAJOR,
dialogues.text: a tall young man wearing an ornate brocaded red and white uniform with "LHS" emblazoned across the chest.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: He has an idea. The anthem ends, and Luke excuses himself and moves forward, buttonholing Mr. Phillips as he comes  down the steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Adele are on ladders, hanging letters on the mar which reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry comes outside and gets their attention. Grandly, he gestures toward the door, and out strides

dialogues.speaker: OLD TIM,
dialogues.text: wearing his new uniform -- it's the Lawson High School dr major's uniform, modified here and there. "B-I-J-O-U" is  proudly emblazoned across his chest in gold brocaded lett Luke and Adele applaud. Old Time looks up at them -- AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim stands at attention, clutching the front door han Mrs. Terwilliger, wearing a new dress, her hair newly and perfectly coiffed, stands at the ready at her candy count ready to sell tickets and refreshments. Harry and Luke nervously pace the lobby. Luke checks his  watch. It's time. He shakes Harry's hand, and nods to Old Tim, who swings the door open...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Immediately, PATRONS come flooding into the theater. Luke exchanges surprised glances with Harry -- then walks outs

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE THEATER
dialogues.text: Luke comes out and looks down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of PATRONS stretches two deep down the block and around the corner. Luke smiles. Success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's selling tickets from behind the candy counter whil Mrs. Terwilliger sells refreshments to a line of CUSTOMER Luke sells a ticket to a WOMAN, who moves away, revealing BOB LEFFERT AND MABEL. Luke smiles at Bob, who smiles back, his eyes now fairly  dancing with life. He plunks down his admission, and Luke hands him two tickets, which he takes with his hook-hand. Mabel smiles at Luke, takes Bob's good hand, and they mov away, revealing A FARMER AND HIS WIFE, 50s. The Farmer steps up and holds out a plucked chicken by it neck. Luke, surprised, jumps back -- then smiles, pulls off two tickets, and exchanges them for the chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only light back here is the light of the movie, spill through the screen. Luke is straightening up the backstag storage area, when Adele taps him on the shoulder. He tur and she throws her arms around his neck and kisses him. S hands him a paper to read.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PAPER
dialogues.text: Luke angles it so he can read it by the light of the scre

dialogues.speaker: IT SAYS
dialogues.text: California State Bar Association

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has PASSED the State Bar examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, thrilled, grabs Adele and picks her up, twirling he around with joy. He sets her down and kisses her passiona

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is frantically threading the changeover projector. bell on the running projector DINGS! once, signalling tha the reel is coming to an end. Harry looks out the window the screen, then back to the task at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke comes out of the office carrying a folded movie post With a satisfied smile, he walks through the lobby, admir how handsome the old place looks. Old Tim, snappily attir in his uniform, is sweeping a tiny pile of debris into a  dustpan. Mrs. Terwilliger is straightening up the candy  counter. All is well. Luke goes to the lobby's poster case. He opens it, and un a brand-new one-sheet poster for "SAND PIRATES" -- the sa design as the one-sheet we saw in Pete's apartment. Methodically, he thumbtacks the poster up and closes the  case. As Luke passes the auditorium doors, a MAN comes out of t theater and crosses to the candy counter. The door stays  open for a moment, and Luke decides to duck inside and ca a bit of the picture.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The second-to-last reel of a black-and-white early-50's  programmer. It's nighttime in the desert. A huge full moo hangs over a B-movie soundstage version of the pyramids. GREGORY, a dark, handsome leading man in a pith helmet is engaged in a fierce swordfight with KHALID, the villain. Pete takes a seat on the aisle near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think you can win this, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalid lunges and draws Gregory's blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ala "Khalid") "Ha! I'd say I was winning!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! I'd say I was winning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's look is "How did I know he was gonna say that?" Onscreen, an EVIL HENCHMAN is sneaking up behind Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gregory! Look out!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory! Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete did it again. Onscreen, Gregory turns and kills the Henchman, then quic dispatches Khalid. He stands over the body, catches his b and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Rebecca. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA, a beautiful American woman, comes into view and  takes our attention because she's being played by Sandra  Sinclair, Pete Appleton's ex-girlfriend...

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: His mouth is gaping open. He stares at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Sandra...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands. Confused, he stumbles backward, moving into lobby as the Man goes back into the auditorium with his  popcorn and the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is staring at the closed auditorium doors. Old Tim a Mrs. Terwilliger take note of his odd behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke? Dear, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without answering, Luke turns and runs to the poster case

dialogues.speaker: ON THE POSTER
dialogues.text: Forget the cheesy B-movie artwork. As Luke looks at the  poster, it's clear that he's remembering something. He lo at the picture of Sandra -- then scans down to the credit block at the bottom of the poster. His eyes lock upon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god... my god... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, all of Pete Appleton's worries have come crashi down on him... ...because he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warning bell DINGS! twice, but the changeover project carbon arcs keep sputtering and the motor keeps dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) Oh, baby, make your daddy happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's trying to keep the projector going, as the previo reel is about to end. Given no other choice, he finally g the changeover projector a good swift kick. It hums to life. A perfect changeover. Harry pets the  projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good girl. No matter what I  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns away, he feels a sudden, sharp pain in his le arm. Wincing, he grabs his arm, staggers back towards a c and sits heavily. He tries to clear his throat, but it dissolves into a hac choking COUGH. He tries to stand, but drops to his knees, clutching his left arm harder than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry falls to the floor, and as he does

dialogues.speaker: THE FILM
dialogues.text: breaks in the projector gate... flap! Flap! Flap!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is still staring at the poster, lost in thought. Offscreen, we HEAR the audience WHISTLING AND HOOTING in  reaction to the broken film. Mrs. Terwilliger has been calling Luke's name, but he doe come out of his stupor until Old Tim comes up behind him spins him around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Luke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stares wide-eyed at the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke! Luke, something's wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The film broke, and I can't raise Harry on the house phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still dazed) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to talk to them before  they tear the theater apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Luke pulls himself together, hears the audience  noise, and moves toward the auditorium doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the shouting and tossing of popcorn and debris, Luke tries to regain his composure as he strides down the aisl toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, folks, this happens every  once in a while, just settle down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd quiets down a bit. Luke shields his eyes from t light and calls up to the projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry, why don't you cut the  projector and bring up the house  lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction. Just the flickering beam of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry? Harry...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, gripped by a sudden fear, rushes up the aisle and i the lobby. The crowd goes silent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim and Mrs. Terwilliger watch as Luke tears into the lobby and makes for the balcony stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and charges between the seats and up the stairs to the projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke bursts in the sees Harry on the floor. He rushes ove and kneels down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) The film broke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know... keep still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN pops his head into the projection booth door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the man) Get Doc Lardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is in bed, eyes closed. Doc Lardner has a stethosco to his chest. He leans up and pats Harry's hand. He stands and comes over to Luke and Adele, who are near door. Just outside, angling for a view into the room, are Old Tim and Mrs. Terwilliger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty massive heart attack.  His lungs have filled with fluid,  and, well... it seems as though his  body is just... shutting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get him to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we could, and the move didn't  kill him, there'd be very little we  could do there that we can't do here. (puts his hand on  Luke's shoulder) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's eyelids flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Did you... did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke rushes to Harry's side and takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you... did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Did you fix the damn film? It broke  in the last reel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Everyone went home. We offered  them refunds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closes his eyes) Vultures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not happy about this, mind you,  but if I have to go, at least I'm  going in my own bed, the same bed my  Lily died in, and... knowing that my  son is alive. That's not too shabby,  is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, I know about these  things. I've seen it before. It's  all right. It's... all right. You're  here. Oh, God, I love you, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry smiles.  Luke kisses his hand and leans up, whisper in Harry's ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you... Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry smiles faintly, looks at Luke. He nods, then closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh, so... much... lighter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Harry exhales. His face relaxes, completely at pe He doesn't breathe again. Luke looks at Harry's face for a moment. Then as the tear well up, he leans over and ever-so-gently places a kiss o Harry's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful, bright, sunny day. Luke and Adele stand the front of the large group of mourners. REVEREND COLEMA 50s, conducts the service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We commit to the earth the mortal  remains of Harry Bernard Trumbo,  safe in the knowledge that his  immortal soul is at peace and at  last reunited with his beloved Lillian  in the bosom of the Lord. Let us  pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone bows their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Lord is my shepherd, I shall  not want, he maketh me to lie down  in green pastures..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks up at the sky, then steps forward and lays a s rose on Harry's casket. Then, as everyone surreptitiously watches, he turns and walks away from the gravesite, towa the cemetery entrance. Adele watches Luke depart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she's not alone. Agents Saunders and Brett are wat everything from their car, which is parked nearby. As Luke walks away, Saunders snaps his photo with a long- lens camera...

dialogues.speaker: THE BASE OF THE WAR MEMORIAL,
dialogues.text: and Luke's name inscribed there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands in front of the memorial, head bowed. After a moment, he sits, leaning against the memorial.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: Lost in thought, he buries his face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I join you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks up, squinting. Adele stands above him, backlit the golden light of the sundown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits next to him. Tentatively, she touches his should He leans into her, and she enfolds her arm in his. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father said... that I would  start to remember things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Adele feels as though she's walking on eggshell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) What... do you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... everything. It started coming  back a couple of days ago. I remember  everything now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly. I'm... I'm not... Harry wasn't  my father. And I'm not... I'm not  Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes. All her suspicions are suddenly  confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adrift) Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her tears start, and she moves to hug Luke -- but instead she starts hitting him, flailing, beating on his chest. H hugs her tightly, and she completely lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Oh, god, I knew! I knew! I knew from  the start! I wanted you to be Luke!  I wanted you to be alive! You're so  much like him, you have no idea. No  wonder everyone else accepted you!  You don't know what you -- what Luke  meant to this town, suddenly being  alive! You don't know what this town  lost! You just don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away, stands, and looks him in the eye. Luke ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing uncontrollably) I knew you weren't Luke! And I tried  not to fall in love with you! And...  I don't even know your name! Oh,  god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke moves toward her. She backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love with you, too, Delly.  Only now I don't know how I feel,  about you or about anything. I only  think I know how Luke would feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still sobbing. He moves to her, takes her in his ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly, shhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away) No... I can't... I have to... I  can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off, crying...

dialogues.speaker: ON SHERIFF ELDRIDGE,
dialogues.text: making short work of a steak and eggs. As he powers down meal, Agents Saunders and Brett, distinctly out-of-place their dark suits and hats, enter the diner. They take not of Eldridge, and come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I got the uniform to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Special Agent Walter Saunders,  this is Special Agent Steven Brett,  FBI. May we have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flash identification, which Eldridge notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) Please, sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit across from Eldridge. As Saunders speaks, Agent  Brett pulls a photo from his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of days ago, a county flood  control maintenance crew pulled a  car out of the Lawson Wash ocean  outlet. They checked its registration,  and when the owner was identified,  they notified us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Brett slides the photo toward Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: It's Peter Appleton -- Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, that'd be Luke Trumbo. Looks  like you boys've solved a little  mystery we've had going on for a few  months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, that's a photo of man named  Peter Appleton. He's been missing  from Los Angeles for close to three  months now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, there's got to be a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff -- this man is a suspected  communist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Oh, and by the way, from here on, he's PETE again.) Pete sits across from Eldridge, Saunders and Brett. The  silence in the room is thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I under arrest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge glances at Agent Saunders, who stares at Pete  impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, but these gentlemen would  like to get some answers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else to tell you.  I wasn't hiding out. I hit my head  and I didn't remember anything until  a few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that you remember who you are,  were you planning on telling anyone  your true identity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriend. If she still is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his notebook) Would that be Miss Sinclair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic smile) No. No, not Miss Sinclair. I'm talking  about Adele Lardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Saunders glances at Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor's daughter. She was Luke  Trumbo's sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Appleton, I have reason to believe  you're holding something back, and  that just rubs me the wrong way. (pause) Sir, are you a communist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) No. Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. All right. We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete comes out into the bright midday sun. It takes a mom for his eyes to adjust, and when they do, he becomes awar of perhaps TWENTY PEOPLE lining the sidewalk in front of station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize several of the people. Carl Leffert. Bob Lef and Mabel Lanier. Daley Thornhill. Katie Rutherford. Stan Lawson. Now, there's nothing in the least bit threatening about the gathering -- and that's what's so disturbing ab it. They're not an angry mob, they're just standing there running the gamut of emotions. Shock. Disillusionment. Betrayal. It's an awkward moment. Pete doesn't quite know how to re He wants to go over and talk to them, but he wouldn't kno what to say. He wishes one of them would talk to him, jus say something, anything. But no one does. Then, Bob Leffert turns away from Pete. He shoves his hoo hand into his pocket and sullenly moves away, followed by Mabel, then his brother, then the others... ...leaving Pete alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim, in his doorman's uniform, stands by the open, em door. Mrs. Terwilliger, behind the candy counter, wipes up an  imaginary spill, a full wheel of unsold tickets by her el Pete anxiously paces the lobby. He looks into THE AUDITORIUM. Every seat is empty. He glances at his watch, then turns to Old Tim and Mrs.  Terwilliger:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's close up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mrs. Terwilliger and Old Tim silently shamble off, Pet goes over and flips OFF several light switches. Most of t theater goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete sits leaning up against the base of the dark sign. A gentle breeze tousles his hair as he gazes up at the star After a moment, he HEARS footsteps coming up the ladder t the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele climbs onto the roof, comes over and sits down next Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure a lot of people down in  L.A. are worried sick about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? I'm sure a lot more people  down in L.A. want a piece of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Luke was a pretty good guy,  wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful smile) Oh, yes. Yes, he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... let me tell you, I'm not  Luke. I know who I am now, and you  don't. And... I don't like me very  much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) You know, it's going to take me a  while to get used to calling you  Pete. (she takes it for a  spin) Pete. Pete. It's a nice name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I like it. I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly, I want to do the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete can't believe he just said that -- but he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, I'm a lot of things,  but communist isn't one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you only went to one meeting,  why does anyone care? Besides, why  should it even matter if you were a  communist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Delly, look at the country  today. We're fighting communists in  Korea, we're paranoid about the  Russians, we've got this thing with  the Rosenbergs and the atomic bomb...
